author: Jeff Parsons
title: Let's go round again: Pebble launches circular smartwatch with two day battery life
text:
Not all smartwatches are bulky, black wrist computers and Pebble, the Kickstarter sensation , seems to be paying attention to the trend.
The company has just revealed the Pebble Watch Round, a stylish circular smartwatch that follows the likes of the Samsung Gear S2 and the LG G Watch Urbane by adopting a traditional round clock face.
So far Pebble has seen off the threat from the Apple Watch thanks to a dedicated legion of fans - many of whom supported the gadget during its crowd funding days.
Billed as the “thinnest and lightest smartwatch in the world,” the Pebble Time Round is only 7.5mm thick and weighs 28g.
It uses a colour e-ink screen rather than a LED-based display - meaning a better battery life.
The Pebble Time Round will launch in the UK next year
According to Pebble, it’ll last up to two days and a single 15 minute charge will give it enough juice for a full day.
What’s more, it doesn’t matter if you have an iPhone or an Android one - the Pebble Time Round will work with both and there are thousands of apps from a community of developers.
“It’s the first smartwatch that looks like a classic wristwatch and furthers our mission to create useful technology that blends into your everyday life, not the other way around,” said Eric Migicovsky, CEO and co-founder of Pebble.
"We recognise that wearable technology can't be one-size-fits-all and are fiercely committed to offering unique choices that suit individual style and expression,” he said.
The company says the new watch will start at $249 (£163) and launch in the UK and Europe at some point in 2016.
